hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Contraction Breakout Fade in Stress Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS or high-volatility BEAR regimes, a sharp, high-volume price breakout from a period of low volatility (contraction) will fail and revert to the pre-breakout range 70% of the time, providing a high Sharpe ratio fade opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In stressed markets, low-volatility periods often precede continued directional moves, but initial sharp breakouts are frequently traps (stop hunts, liquidity grabs) driven by panic before price reverts. High volume confirms the trap is widely participated in.
entry_conditions: Regime == STRESS or (BEAR with 20D historical volatility > 80%)
BTC 1H Bollinger Band Width (20,2) has been below its 20-period 25th percentile for 6+ hours (contraction)
Price then breaks > 1.5% outside the prior 6-hour range on a 1H candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to the midpoint of the pre-breakout 6-hour range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves a further 1.5% in the breakout direction beyond the entry signal candle

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If in STRESS regimes, more than 40% of such breakouts continue directionally for a sustained move (> 3% beyond entry) instead of reverting.
